Some of the grant funds will be used to employ additional personnel*
If we are to increase distribution we must enlarge our staff some¬
what. Be adding one or two individuals to the network staff, we
should improve the efficiency and competency of the organization.
Personnel funds will total about 20,000 dollars.
Finally, we will use a share of the money — less than 10 thousand
dollars to purchase a stock of audio tape. Currently the network
has a large tape pool. Our plan is to purchase tape stock on
10 inch reels and all future music programs will be distributed on
the lai:£er reels — thus eliminating a variety of production
problems both at the network headquarters and in the individual
stations.
The grant was made available to NERN for utilization in calendar
1969.
We expect to expend the first funds for tape acquisition sometime
in July — we anticipate employing personnel as needed about Sept¬
ember 1 — and we have already begun the process of program ac-
quisit&onaand development. It is our plan to have programs and
series in distribution to stations on or before October 1.
Thus the benefits of the $65,000 CPB fcrant to NERN will be realized
in the last quarter of 1969. We are confident that educational
radio stations will be pleased with the new programs that will be
made available to them.
